00078 #include "machine.h"
00079 #include "regs.h"
00080 #include "options.h"
00081 
00082 #define MAX_IDEPS 3
00083 #define MD_STA_OP_INDEX 0
00084 #define MD_STD_OP_INDEX 1
00085 
00086 
00087 #define MAX_HYBRID_BPRED 8 /* maximum number of sub-components in a hybrid branch predictor */
00088 #define MAX_DECODE_WIDTH 16
00089 #define MAX_EXEC_WIDTH 16
00090 #define MAX_PREFETCHERS 4 /* per cache; so IL1 can have MAX_PREFETCHERS prefetchers independent of the DL1 or LLC */
00091 
00092 typedef qword_t seq_t;
00093 
00094 union val_t {
00095   byte_t b;
00096   word_t w;
00097   dword_t dw;
00098   qword_t q;
00099   sfloat_t s;
00100   dfloat_t d;
00101   efloat_t e;
00102 };
00103 
00104 /* structure for a uop's list of output dependencies (dataflow children) */
00105 struct odep_t {
00106   struct uop_t * uop;
00107   int op_num;
00108   bool aflags; /* TRUE if this odep link is for an AFLAGS dependency */
00109   struct odep_t * next;
00110 };
00111 
00112 /* Note, the memory table is per-byte indexed */
00113 struct spec_byte_t {
00114   byte_t val;
00115   md_addr_t addr;
00116   struct spec_byte_t * next;
00117   struct spec_byte_t * prev;
00118   enum md_fault_type fault;
00119 };
00120 
00121 /* uArch micro-op structure */
00122 struct uop_t
00123 {
00124   struct core_t * core; /* back pointer to core so we know which core this uop is from */
00125   struct Mop_t * Mop; /* back pointer to parent marco-inst */
00126 
00127   struct {
00128     uop_inst_t raw_op; /* original undecoded uop format  (from md_get_flow::flowtab) */
00129     enum md_opcode op; /* specific opcode for this uop */
00130     unsigned int opflags; /* decoded flags */
00131 
00132     bool has_imm; /* TRUE if this uop has an immediate (which is stored in the next two consecutive uops */
00133     bool is_imm; /* TRUE if this uop is not a real uop, but just part of an immediate */
00134     int idep_name[MAX_IDEPS]; /* register input dependencies */
00135     int odep_name; /* register output dependencies */
00136     int iflags; /* flag input dependencies */
00137     int oflags; /* flags modified by this uop */
00138 
00139     int mem_size; /* size of memory data; if load/store */
00140 
00141     bool BOM; /* TRUE if first uop of macro (Beginning of Macro) */
00142     bool EOM; /* TRUE if last uop of macro (End of Macro) */
00143 
00144     /* idep names, odep name(s?), predecode flags (is_load, etc.), target */
00145     bool is_ctrl; /* Is branch/jump/call etc.? */
00146     bool is_load; /* Is load? */
00147     bool is_sta;  /* Is store-address uop? */
00148     bool is_std;  /* Is store-data uop? */
00149     bool is_nop;  /* Is NOP? */
00150 
00151     /* assume unique uop ID assigned when Mop cracked */
00152     seq_t Mop_seq;
00153     seq_t uop_seq; /* we use a seq that's a combination of the Mop seq and the uop flow-index */
00154 
00155     enum md_fu_class FU_class; /* What type of ALU does this uop use? */
00156 
00157     /* uop-fusion */
00158     bool in_fusion;      /* this uop belongs to a fusion of two or more uops */
00159     bool is_fusion_head; /* first uop of a fused set? */
00160     int fusion_size;    /* total number of uops in this fused set */
00161     struct uop_t * fusion_head; /* pointer to first uop of a fused set */
00162     struct uop_t * fusion_next; /* pointer to next uop in this fused set */
00163   } decode;
00164 
00165   struct {
00166     int ROB_index;
00167     int RS_index;
00168     int LDQ_index;
00169     int STQ_index;
00170     int port_assignment; /* execution port binding */
00171     bool full_fusion_allocated; /* TRUE when all sub-uops of a fused-uop have been successfully alloc'd */
00172   } alloc;
00173 
00174   struct {
00175     bool in_readyQ;
00176     seq_t action_id;
00177     /* these pointers are only between uops in the OOO core (RS,ROB,etc.) */
00178     struct uop_t * idep_uop[MAX_IDEPS];
00179     struct odep_t * odep_uop;
00180 
00181     bool ivalue_valid[MAX_IDEPS];   /* the value is valid */
00182     union val_t ivalue[MAX_IDEPS]; /* input value */
00183 
00184     bool ovalue_valid;
00185     union val_t ovalue; /* output value */
00186     dword_t oflags;     /* output flags */
00187 
00188     /* for load instructions */
00189     tick_t when_data_loaded;
00190     tick_t when_addr_translated;
00191     
00192     int uops_in_RS; /* used only for fusion-head */
00193     int num_replays; /* number of times reached exec but ivalue not ready */
00194     int dummy1; /* padding */
00195     int dummy2; /* padding */
00196     int dummy3; /* padding */
00197   } exec;
00198 
00199   struct {
00200     /* register information */
00201     union val_t ivalue[MAX_IDEPS];
00202     union val_t ovalue;
00203     union val_t prev_ovalue; /* value before this instruction (for recovery) */
00204 
00205     md_ctrl_t ictrl;            /* control regs input values */
00206     md_ctrl_t octrl;            /* control regs output values */
00207 
00208     /* memory information */
00209     md_addr_t virt_addr;
00210     md_paddr_t phys_addr;
00211     enum md_fault_type fault;
00212     union val_t mem_value;
00213 
00214     struct spec_byte_t * spec_mem[12]; /* 12 for FSTE */
00215 
00216     /* register dependence pointers */
00217     struct uop_t * idep_uop[MAX_IDEPS];
00218     struct odep_t * odep_uop;
00219 
00220     bool recover_inst; /* TRUE if next inst is at wrong PC */
00221   } oracle;
00222 
00223   struct {
00224     tick_t when_decoded;
00225     tick_t when_allocated;
00226     tick_t when_itag_ready[MAX_IDEPS]; /* these track readiness of dependencies, which is different from the */
00227     tick_t when_otag_ready;            /* readiness of the actual VALUE since schedule and exec are decoupled. */
00228     tick_t when_ival_ready[MAX_IDEPS]; /* when_oval_ready == when_completed */
00229     tick_t when_ready;
00230     tick_t when_issued;
00231     tick_t when_exec;
00232     tick_t when_completed;
00233   } timing;
00234 
00235   int flow_index;
00236 };
00237 
00238 /* x86 Macro-op structure */
00239 struct Mop_t
00240 {
00241   struct core_t * core; /* back pointer to core so we know which core this uop is from */
00242   int valid;
00243 
00244   //struct {    /*Struct that stores the physical and virtual address of the Macro-op*/
00245   // md_addr_t paddr;   /*Helps in maintaining page tables*/
00246   // md_addr_t vaddr;
00247   // unsigned char mem_size;
00248   //}addr;
00249 
00250   struct {
00251     md_addr_t PC;
00252     md_addr_t pred_NPC;
00253     md_inst_t inst;
00254     bool first_byte_requested;
00255     bool last_byte_requested;
00256 
00257     seq_t jeclear_action_id;
00258     bool branch_mispred;
00259 #ifdef __cplusplus
00260     class bpred_state_cache_t * bpred_update; /* bpred update info */
00261 #else
00262     void * bpred_update;
00263 #endif
00264   } fetch;
00265 
00266   struct {
00267     enum md_opcode op;
00268     unsigned int opflags;
00269     int flow_length;
00270     int last_uop_index; /* index of last uop (maybe != flow_length due to imm's) */
00271     int rep_seq; /* number indicating REP iteration */
00272     bool first_rep; /* TRUE if this is the iteration */
00273     md_addr_t targetPC; /* for branches, target PC */
00274 
00275     /* pre-decode to save repeated MD_OP_FLAGS lookups */
00276     bool is_trap;
00277     bool is_ctrl;
00278 
00279     int last_stage_index; /* index of next uop to remove from decode pipe */
00280 
00281     enum fpstack_ops_t fpstack_op; /* nop/push/pop/poppop FP/x87 top-of-stack */
00282   } decode;
00283 
00284   /* pointer to the raw uops that implement this Mop */
00285   struct uop_t * uop;
00286 
00287   struct {
00288     int complete_index; /* points to first uop that has not yet completed execution (-1 == all done) */
00289     int commit_index; /* points to first uop that has not yet been committed */
00290     bool jeclear_in_flight;
00291   } commit;
00292 
00293   struct {
00294     md_addr_t NextPC;
00295     seq_t seq;
00296     bool zero_rep; /* TRUE if inst has REP of zero */
00297     bool spec_mode; /* this instruction is on wrong path? */
00298     bool recover_inst; /* TRUE if the NPC for this Mop is wrong */
00299   } oracle;
00300 
00301   struct {
00302     tick_t when_fetch_started;
00303     tick_t when_fetched;
00304     tick_t when_MS_started; /* for complex Mops needing the MS, cycle on which MS starts delivering uops */
00305     tick_t when_decode_started;
00306     tick_t when_decode_finished;
00307     tick_t when_commit_started;
00308     tick_t when_commit_finished;
00309   } timing;
00310 
00311   struct {
00312     int num_uops;
00313     int num_eff_uops;
00314     int num_refs;
00315     int num_loads;
00316     int num_branches;
00317   } stat;
00318 };

00321 /* holds all of the parameters for a core, plus any additional helper variables
00322    for command line parsing (e.g., config strings) */
00323 struct core_knobs_t
00324 {
00325   char * model;
00326 
00327   struct {
00328     int byteQ_size;
00329     int byteQ_linesize; /* in bytes */
00330     int depth; /* predecode pipe */
00331     int width; /* predecode pipe */
00332     int IQ_size;
00333     int jeclear_delay;
00334 
00335     int   num_bpred_components;
00336     char *bpred_opt_str[MAX_HYBRID_BPRED];
00337     char *fusion_opt_str;
00338     char *dirjmpbtb_opt_str;
00339     char *indirjmpbtb_opt_str;
00340     char *ras_opt_str;
00341 
00342     bool warm_bpred;
00343   } fetch;
00344 
00345   struct {
00346     int depth; /* decode pipe */
00347     int width; /* decode pipe */
00348     int target_stage;        /* stage in which a wrong taken BTB target is detected and corrected */
00349     int *max_uops; /* maximum number of uops emittable per decoder */
00350     int MS_latency; /* number of cycles from decoder[0] to uROM/MS */
00351     int uopQ_size;
00352     int fusion_mode; /* bitmask of which fusion types are allowed */
00353     int decoders[MAX_DECODE_WIDTH];
00354     int num_decoder_specs;
00355     int branch_decode_limit; /* maximum number of branches decoded per cycle */
00356     bool fusion_none; /* this takes precedence over -fusion:all */
00357     bool fusion_all;  /* and then this takes precedence over the subsequent flags */
00358     bool fusion_load_op;
00359     bool fusion_sta_std;
00360     bool fusion_partial;
00361   } decode;
00362 
00363   struct {
00364     int depth; /* alloc pipe */
00365     int width; /* alloc pipe */
00366     bool drain_flush; /* use drain flush? */
00367   } alloc;
00368 
00369   struct {
00370     int RS_size;
00371     int LDQ_size;
00372     int STQ_size;
00373     struct {
00374       int num_FUs;
00375       int *ports;
00376     } port_binding[NUM_FU_CLASSES];
00377     int num_exec_ports;
00378     int payload_depth;
00379     int fu_bindings[NUM_FU_CLASSES][MAX_EXEC_WIDTH];
00380     int num_bindings[NUM_FU_CLASSES];
00381     int latency[NUM_FU_CLASSES];
00382     int issue_rate[NUM_FU_CLASSES];
00383     char * memdep_opt_str;
00384     int fp_penalty; /* extra cycles to forward to FP cluster */
00385     bool tornado_breaker;
00386     bool throttle_partial;
00387   } exec;
00388 
00389   struct {
00390     /* prefetch arguments */
00391     int IL1_num_PF; int IL1_PFFsize; int IL1_PFthresh; int IL1_PFmax; int IL1_PF_buffer_size;
00392     int IL1_PF_filter_size; int IL1_PF_filter_reset; bool IL1_PF_on_miss;
00393     int IL1_WMinterval; double IL1_low_watermark; double IL1_high_watermark;
00394     int DL1_num_PF; int DL1_PFFsize; int DL1_PFthresh; int DL1_PFmax; int DL1_PF_buffer_size;
00395     int DL1_PF_filter_size; int DL1_PF_filter_reset; bool DL1_PF_on_miss;
00396     int DL1_WMinterval; double DL1_low_watermark; double DL1_high_watermark;
00397     char * DL1_MSHR_cmd;
00398     int DL2_num_PF; int DL2_PFFsize; int DL2_PFthresh; int DL2_PFmax; int DL2_PF_buffer_size;
00399     int DL2_PF_filter_size; int DL2_PF_filter_reset; bool DL2_PF_on_miss;
00400     int DL2_WMinterval; double DL2_low_watermark; double DL2_high_watermark;
00401     char * DL2_MSHR_cmd;
00402 
00403     /* for storing command line parameters */
00404     char * IL1_opt_str;
00405     char * ITLB_opt_str;
00406     char * DL1_opt_str;
00407     char * DL2_opt_str;
00408     char * DTLB_opt_str;
00409     char * DTLB2_opt_str;
00410 
00411     char * IL1PF_opt_str[MAX_PREFETCHERS];
00412     char * DL1PF_opt_str[MAX_PREFETCHERS];
00413     char * DL2PF_opt_str[MAX_PREFETCHERS];
00414 
00415     bool warm_caches;
00416     int syscall_memory_latency;
00417   } memory;
00418 
00419   struct {
00420     int ROB_size;
00421     int width;
00422     int branch_limit; /* maximum number of branches committed per cycle */
00423   } commit;
